intro: Pseuduvaria kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Guangdong pseuduvaria, is a flowering plant species native to southern China. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth, glossy surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
